user_flow_title: Commenting and Reacting on NN Live+

steps.start: After finding an interesting NeighborNet Live+ feed on the app
steps.interface: Live stream details page shows a video with a red 'LIVE' label, location and distance (e.g., 'xx mi · xx Blvd'), title, viewer stats ('xx notified; xx views'), and a map with icon. Below are the Summary, Timeline, and Chat sections.

steps.action: Scroll down to explore more details about this Live+ feed.
steps.interface: Summary gives more info. Timeline shows timestamped updates (e.g., 'xx:xx, xxxxx'; 'xx:xx, xxxxx'). Video stays pinned at the top, emoji reaction bar with counts (e.g., xx reactions) floats on the right, and Chat input bar remains at the bottom.

steps.action: Tap the chat input bar.
steps.interface: The comment page appears, showing a vertical list of user comments in chronological order. Each comment includes a user profile icon, username (e.g., 'xxx'), timestamp (e.g., 'xx:xx'), comment text (e.g., 'xxx'), and buttons to like, dislike, or reply. Usernames can be custom or anonymous. Input field at the bottom says 'Leave a public comment...' with a blue arrow to send. The page title stays at the top, with a back arrow to return to the main post.

steps.action: Like a comment and type your own.
steps.interface: A 'Community Guidelines' pop-up appears with three rules: '1. Be kind', '2. Be respectful', '3. Be helpful'. Link to 'Read more →' and an 'X' to close. Background is dimmed.

steps.action: Close the pop-up and submit your comment
steps.system_action: The system checks your comment and finds it follows the Community Guidelines.
Your comment is posted and shown in the feed. It also appears on the reporter's screen.
steps.interface: The comment section scrolls to your comment. Video keeps playing at the top.

steps.action: Tap on the video to continue watching.
steps.interface: Live stream continues. Reporter says, 'xxx'
steps.true_reasoning: Your comment appears in the feed and the host responds, confirming successful engagement through comments.
